title: SIR woes continue on the last day of hearing in West Bengal

content: It symbolises the creation of a strong base of global talent that will drive the quantum transition in the decades to come and place India at the forefront of the global revolution, he says

content: Girls have secured 60.72% of the total MBBS seats, while the same for dental and AYUSH programmes fall between 76.17% and 85%

content: Earlier, airport buses stopped only at designated BMTC bus stops, many of which were located far from metro stations

content: Project Cheetah, India‚Äôs cheetah reintroduction programme was kickstarted on September 17, 2022, with Mr. Modi releasing eight¬†Cheetahs, translocated from Namibia, at Kuno

content: Of them, 30 surrender in Bijapur, while 21 surrender in Sukma; in Sukma, where 21 cadres have returned to the mainstream, the Naxalite organisation suffers a major setback

content: As part of off-grid solar electrification initiative by government, solar power facilities with battery storage have been provided to 611 tribal households in Palutla region of Yerragondapalem at ‚Çπ2.86 crore

content: Proprietor says Anto Antony, MP, borrowed ‚Çπ2 crore from the group ahead of the 2019 LS election, but repaid only ‚Çπ20 lakh. The MP admits to borrowing the money, but says the full amount was repaid. The group is being investigated by the ED for alleged money laundering

content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu is unhappy that the SIT report is not to his liking, asserts Botcha Satyanarayana

title: BJP kicks off Assembly poll campaign from Thrissur
content: BJP president Nitin Nabin launches the campaign by writing slogans on a wall in Kalathode, symbolising the party‚Äôs outreach efforts. The choice of Thrissur reflects the BJP‚Äôs ambition to leverage its 2024 Lok Sabha victory and signal a transformative shift in Kerala‚Äôs political landscape ahead of the upcoming elections.

content: Swiss racer Franjo von Allmen captured the Olympic downhill Saturday to win the first gold medal at the Milan Cortina Games.

title: Ex-MLB player Puig found guilty in gambling probe
content: A jury has found ex-major league outfielder Yasiel Puig guilty of obstruction of justice and lying to federal officials, the U.S. Attorney's Office said Friday.

title: Hall of Fame envisions changes after '26 outcry
content: Jim Porter said the Hall of Fame plans to return to in-person voting and that the vote will likely happen closer to the annual reveal at NFL Honors -- the Thursday before the Super Bowl.

title: Vonn completes training run, ready for downhill
content: Lindsey Vonn completed another successful training run Saturday on the eve of the race at the Milan Cortina Olympics little more than a week after tearing the ACL in her left knee.

title: Reverse? Brady backs Kraft, 'get that 7th ring'
content: Tom Brady, who was widely criticized this week after he said he didn't have a "dog in the fight" in Sunday's Super Bowl between the Patriots and Seahawks, indicated in a social media post Friday night that he is backing his former team.

title: Speedskater Lollobrigida wins host Italy's 1st gold
content: Speedskater Francesca Lollobrigida won host Italy's first gold medal of the Milan Cortina Games on Saturday, taking the women's 3,000 meters in an Olympics-record time.

title: St. John's tops UConn as Pitino ties No. 3 in wins
content: St. John's landed its first marquee win of the season Friday night, knocking off No. 3 UConn 81-72 to snap the Huskies' 18-game winning streak in front of an electric crowd at Madison Square Garden.

title: Ex-NFL LB Darron Lee charged in girlfriend's death
content: Former NFL linebacker Darron Lee, the Jets' first-round pick in 2016, was arrested and charged with first-degree murder in the death of his girlfriend, the Hamilton County (Tennessee) Sheriff's Office announced Friday.

content: Our panel discusses Gervonta Davis' future, Ryan Garcia's title chances, Tyson Fury's return and more.

content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

title: Baldur's Gate TV show coming to HBO
content: Craig Mazin, showrunner for "The Last of Us" and "Chernobyl," will be bringing Baldur's Gate's iconic characters to television.

content: Players can also claim a limited-time Supercharge Pack for Ultimate Team as part of their subscription.

title: 1 dead, 13 hurt as fairground ride collapses in Haryana's Surajkund Mela
content: Tragedy struck the Surajkund Mela in Faridabad Saturday evening when a swing ride collapsed, killing a police inspector and injuring thirteen others. The brave officer lost his life attempting to rescue people as the ride tilted. Authorities have vowed swift action against the operator, with an FIR to be registered.

title: SpaceX 'hiring problem': Elon Musk says engineers not ready to relocate
content: SpaceX faces a significant hurdle in attracting engineers and technicians to its Starbase facility in South Texas due to limited job prospects for their spouses. Elon Musk highlighted this 'significant other' problem, noting the remote location's scarcity of non-SpaceX employment. This challenge, though less severe, also impacts Tesla's recruitment in Texas, contrasting with easier relocations from California's job-rich areas.

title: 557 days of wait: Mohammed Siraj's unexpected T20I World Cup return
content: Mohammed Siraj made an unexpected return to India's T20I side for their World Cup opener against the USA. Called up as standby cover, he was drafted into the playing XI after Jasprit Bumrah fell ill. This marked Siraj's first T20 international appearance in 557 days, a significant moment on the grandest stage.

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
content: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.

title: Widowed DIL's maintenance survives FIL's death: Delhi High Court
content: The ruling settles a long-standing interpretative question that has existed long in relation to Sections 19, 21 and 22 of the HAMA and has extensive consequences on widowed women who are left without a means of livelihood after the death of their husband.

title: T20 WC: Romario Shepherd lights-up tournament with hat-trick - Watch
content: Romario Shepherd claimed the inaugural hat-trick of the 2026 T20 World Cup during the West Indies' opening match against Scotland. His crucial wickets in the 17th over significantly hampered Scotland's chase of 182. The West Indies ultimately secured a 35-run victory, with Shimron Hetmyer's 64 contributing to their total.

title: ‚ÄòIn 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be ‚Ä¶‚Äô: Musk makes a bold prediction
content: Elon Musk predicts space will become the most cost-effective location for AI data centers within three years. He cited advantages like five times greater solar panel efficiency, no need for batteries due to constant sunlight, and the absence of atmospheric interference.

title: Father's 3 wives & a dead live-in partner: Why Ghaziabad sisters‚Äô suicide is getting murkier
content: Three minor sisters in Ghaziabad died by suicide after their father confiscated their mobile phones due to their obsession with Korean culture. Investigations revealed the girls were depressed and unable to access their usual online activities. The father has three wives, who are biological sisters, and the girls' suicide note was addressed solely to him.

title: Who is van Schalkwyk: South Africa-born USA bowler who ran through India's batting
content: Shadley Claude van Schalkwyk delivered a stunning performance, taking three wickets in a single over against India in the T20 World Cup 2026 opener. The South African-born all-rounder dismissed Ishan Kishan, Tilak Varma, and Shivam Dube, leaving India reeling at 45 for 4 after the powerplay.

title: Happy Propose Day 2026: Quotes and message for your special someone
content: Valentine's Week continues with Propose Day, a time for expressing affection.  Struggling for the right words? This guide offers 50 sweet, funny, and movie-inspired messages.

title: NFL Super Bowl 2026 Halftime Show: Start time and streaming details
content: Bad Bunny takes over the NFL Super Bowl 2026 Halftime Show in Santa Clara. Find kickoff time, likely halftime window, NBC and Peacock details, full streaming options, UK viewing info, and how to catch Green Day, Charlie Puth, national anthem, trophy presentation, and more right before the Seattle Seahawks and New England Patriots finally fight hard for the Lombardi Trophy.

title: A.J. Allmendinger & Wife Tara: Net Worth, NASCAR Career & Family Growth
content: NASCAR driver A.J. Allmendinger, a two-time Xfinity champion with multiple Cup wins, has an estimated net worth of $18 million. He and his wife, Tara, a former Mrs. North Carolina America and architect, welcomed their son, Aero James, in September 2023. Their story highlights dedication to racing and family support.

title: NHL trade rumors swirl around Andrew Mangiapane as Oilers assess deadline fit
content: The future of Andrew Mangiapane with the Edmonton Oilers has become the center of NHL trade rumors as the deadline approaches. As the issue of production and the change of the lineup is still in progress, Edmonton is considering keeping the forward in the long-term strategy. Analysts feel that the decision that the Oilers will make concerning a possible move will be determined by roster needs, salary considerations, and the desire to make the playoffs.

title: New draft I-T rules 2026 released: What common taxpayers should know
content: In her Union Budget 2026 speech on February 1, FM Nirmala Sitharaman had said, ‚ÄúThe simplified Income Tax Rules and Forms will be notified shortly, giving adequate time to taxpayers to acquaint themselves with its requirements. The forms have been redesigned such that ordinary citizens can comply without difficulty.‚Äù

title: Thunder vs Rockets Feb 7, 2026: Watch Info, Lineups, Injuries & Prediction
content: The Houston Rockets visit the Oklahoma City Thunder on Saturday for their third matchup this season. The Thunder, despite recent losses and key player absences including Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, hold a strong home record. The Rockets, coming off a loss to Charlotte, aim to improve their road performance in this Western Conference clash.

title: T20 WC: Hetmyer scripts history, achieves this feat against Scotland
content: Shimron Hetmyer's explosive 64 off 36 balls powered West Indies to 182 for 5 against Scotland. Despite a shaky start and Scotland's disciplined bowling, Hetmyer's rapid counterattack, including a 81-run partnership with Rovman Powell, secured a competitive total.  His fastest T20 World Cup fifty for West Indies highlighted his improved fitness and clear batting approach.

title: The 50: Archana Gautam and Rajat Dalal get into a fight after latter calls her ‚ÄòDogla‚Äô
content: In a dramatic moment on 'The 50', reality TV icon Archana Gautam clashed with Rajat Dalal, who dared to disrespect her. In response, Archana made it clear that she will not tolerate such behavior. She has often reflected on how the intense demands of the show resonate with her fearless spirit and her tireless commitment to excellence.

title: 'Forza Italia' in cricket: Thomas Draca dreams big on T20 World Cup stage | EXCLUSIVE
content: Italy's Thomas Draca is set to make history at the T20 World Cup, a dream come true for the former aspiring footballer.  He aims to soak in the support and believes Italy can challenge established teams, drawing inspiration from their past footballing triumphs. Draca is also eager to explore India's culture and cuisine during the tournament.

title: Islamabad blast: ISIS affiliate claims responsibility for the attack that killed 36
content: The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for a deadly suicide bombing at a Shiite mosque in Islamabad, which killed at least 36. The group stated Shiites are a target, citing their involvement in fighting ISIS in Syria. Authorities have arrested several suspects, including the alleged mastermind, as investigations into the attacker's background, including time spent in Afghanistan, continue.

title: 18% tariffs, agriculture protected: How India benefits from trade deal with US? Explained
content: India-US trade deal: India and the US have released a joint statement detailing the broad contours of the trade agreement that is expected to be signed in a few weeks. The trade deal is a big boost for India's exports. We decode the benefits:

title: Ukraine-Russia peace deal by June? What Zelenskyy said about US deadline
content: The United States has set a June deadline for Ukraine and Russia to end their nearly four-year conflict, with President Zelenskyy indicating the Trump administration will exert pressure to meet this timeline.  Ukraine confirmed participation in upcoming trilateral talks, likely in Miami, following recent Russian strikes that forced nuclear power plants to reduce output due to attacks on energy infrastructure.

title: T20 WC: Why Sanju Samson is not in India's playing XI against USA
content: Sanju Samson was omitted from India's T20 World Cup 2026 opening XI against the USA. Ishan Kishan takes his place at the top, with Suryakumar Yadav confirming the changes. Jasprit Bumrah is also out due to illness, replaced by Mohammed Siraj.  Washington Sundar also missed out.

title: Why is Jasprit Bumrah not playing India's T20 World Cup opener?
content: India‚Äôs T20 World Cup opener against the USA began with Jasprit Bumrah ruled out due to illness, with Mohammed Siraj replacing him. USA won the toss and chose to bowl on a batting-friendly Wankhede pitch. Suryakumar Yadav admitted pressure but backed India‚Äôs approach, while Monank Patel expressed confidence in his team. India and USA named strong XIs as India began their title defence.

title: When music turns into prayer: Inside the world of 'bhajan concerts'
content: Devotional music concerts are experiencing a surge in popularity, attracting younger audiences with their blend of spiritual chants and contemporary arrangements.  These gatherings offer a unique, immersive experience, fostering community and emotional grounding amidst urban life.  Prime Minister Modi even highlighted this growing trend, calling it 'bhajan-clubbing,' as traditional practices find new relevance.

title: T20 World Cup: Pakistan contemplating U-turn? PCB begins dialogue with ICC
content: The PCB has invoked Force Majeure citing the government instruction to not take the field versus their arch-rivals in the group stage of the multi-nation tournament. In the statement, the government didn't give any further explanation or justification for doing the same. India are schedule to play Pakistan on February 15.

title: Ghaziabad sisters‚Äô suicide: Father has 3 wives; police reveal what happened on night of tragedy
content: Three minor sisters in Ghaziabad died after jumping from their ninth-floor apartment, with preliminary findings suggesting emotional distress linked to family issues and confiscated mobile phones. The girls, aged 16, 14, and 12, were reportedly upset after their father took away their phones due to their attachment to Korean culture. Investigations are ongoing, examining family dynamics and the father's past.

title: Is home-cooked food always healthy?
content: Home-cooked meals are often perceived as the healthiest choice, fostering trust and comfort. While generally true due to fewer preservatives and greater control over ingredients, this isn't always the case. Unhealthy cooking methods and imbalanced meals at home can still pose risks. Experts emphasize the importance of balanced ingredients and variety for truly beneficial homemade diets.

title: Anna Kupp breaks silence with heartfelt note ahead of Super Bowl 2026
content: Cooper Kupp, the Seattle Seahawks' star player, seems to be fully focused for Super Bowl LX on Sunday as he gears up to take the field against the New England Patriots in Levi Stadium, California. Amid this, his wife, Anna, has shared a few words that reflect how the family is gearing up for the big day and how she is supporting him.

title: Precision oncology in cancer care: Doctors explain why it matters today
content: Cancer treatment is evolving beyond a one-size-fits-all approach. Precision oncology analyzes a tumor's genetic makeup to tailor treatments, offering more effective therapies with fewer side effects. This personalized strategy aims to improve patient outcomes and provide more informed care by matching the right treatment to the right patient at the right time.

title: ‚ÄòTamil is India‚Äôs link to world‚Äô: PM to Indian diaspora in Malaysia; what's on agenda
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted the strong cultural and emotional ties between India and Malaysia during his interaction with the Indian diaspora in Kuala Lumpur. He praised the community for preserving traditions and acknowledged Malaysia's significant Indian-origin population as a "living bridge." Modi also emphasised the global importance of the Tamil language and culture.

title: Suicide pact? 4 Jain pilgrims from Karnataka found dead at Bihar ‚Äòdharamshala‚Äô
content: Four Jain pilgrims from Karnataka were found dead in a locked room at a Rajgir dharamshala. Police suspect suicide after discovering sleeping pills and a foul smell. The family had been in the room, locked from the inside, since February 2nd.

title: From 98/2 to 114/7: How Pakistan's T20 World Cup nearly ended on day one
content: Pakistan narrowly avoided a T20 World Cup 2026 opening upset against the Netherlands, thanks to a match-winning 29 off 11 balls from Faheem Ashraf.  Chasing 148, Pakistan collapsed in the middle order, but Ashraf's explosive 19th over turned the tide, securing a three-wicket victory with three balls to spare.

title: 'Khejri Bachao Andolan': Why Rajasthan is rallying to protect its 'Kalpavriksha'?
content: A significant protest is under way in Rajasthan over the felling of the khejri tree. Communities are demanding stronger protection for the state tree, alleging that it is being cut to make way for solar power projects. Political leaders across parties have joined the movement, drawing attention to the tree‚Äôs cultural and ecological significance. In an arid landscape where survival is closely tied to ecology, the debate in western Rajasthan now extends beyond development to questions of history, identity and survival.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs ‚ÄòOpalite‚Äô video fuels Kelce theories
content: ‚ÄãTaylor Swift once again showed why her creative choices rarely stay limited to music alone. On Friday, the pop superstar surprised fans by releasing the music video for her hit single Opalite, and the response was immediate. As Swift continues to dominate headlines while being closely linked to the NFL through her engagement to Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce, the video quickly became a talking point for both Swifties and football fans.

title: Amit Shah Lands In Raipur For Final Push Against Maoists By March 31
content: With the clock ticking relentlessly toward March 31, Union Home Minister Amit Shah arrived in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, launching what is being seen as the final strategic offensive against Maoists in the state.

title: How Shoes Led To Arrest Of Businessman-Turned-Chain Snatcher In Mumbai
content: A single individual has been identified as the mastermind behind a series of chain-snatching incidents that recently hit Mumbai and Navi Mumbai. Police have arrested 49-year-old Mohan Kokate, a resident of Mumbai's Sion area.

title: Indian Among 8 Injured In Russia University Stabbing
content: At least six persons, including an Indian, and two police officers were injured in a stabbing attack on Saturday in a sports hall of foreign students' hostel at a university in Russia's Bashkortostan Republic.

title: 'Closely Engaged With US For Electronics, IP': Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The Indian government is closely engaged with the US for electronics and IP-related matters, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Saturday, as the two nations announced that they have finalised a framework for an interim trade agreement.

title: Video: Student Escapes Death As Bus Stops Inches Away From Head In Kerala
content: A student had a miraculous escape in a road accident Kerala's Malappuram district on Sunday.The incident, which could have turned fatal, was captured on a nearby CCTV camera, visuals of which have now surfaced.

title: Gen-Z Stunt Show On Tractors, Cars Turns Chhattisgarh School Roads Into Danger Zones
content: What should have been a tearful goodbye to school life has morphed into a chilling spectacle on public roads.

title: Anti-Pak Protests In Kashmir After Suicide Bombing At Islamabad Mosque
content: Multiple anti-Pakistan demonstrations erupted in Kashmir valley in protest against the killing of Shia worshippers during a suicide attack in Pakistan's Islamabad.

title: Cop Killed, 13 Injured As Swing Collapses At Haryana's Surajkund Fair
content: An on-duty police inspector was killed, and 13 others were injured when a giant Tsunami swing snapped mid-air and collapsed at the Surajkund Fair in Haryana's Faridabad on Saturday evening, police said.

title: "US Apples Will Land At Minimum Rs 75/Kg": Piyush Goyal Says Farmers Protected
content: India has granted a quota-based duty concession to the US on apples under the interim trade pact, while fully protecting domestic apple growers, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal told NDTV Profit on Saturday.

title: Didn't Intend To Insult: Minister On Remarks Against Colonel Sofia Qureshi
content: With a Supreme Court-mandated deadline for his prosecution looming large, Madhya Pradesh Minister Vijay Shah on Saturday apologised again for his objectionable remarks about Colonel Sofia Qureshi.

title: "Understand Chabahar's Importance But...": N Sitharaman On No Budget Allocation
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has offered a peek into India's thinking on the matter of Iran's Chabahar Port, where India has been investing heavily in recent years, to reap the benefits of the strategic location.

title: NDTV Profit Conclave 2026 Highlights: "Private Sector Should Participate In India's Growth": Nirmala Sitharaman
content: NDTV Profit Conclave 2026 Live Updates: The NDTV Profit Conclave 2026, themed "India: The Real Deal," began, with this year's edition taking place in Delhi.

title: 24 Killed In Drone Attack By Paramilitary Group In Sudan
content: A drone attack by a notorious paramilitary group hit a vehicle carrying displaced families in central Sudan Saturday, killing at least 24 people, including eight children, a doctors' group said.

title: "Will Be Strong Fight. DMK Seems Nervous": N Sitharaman On Tamil Nadu Polls
content: The NDA will give a strong fight to the DMK in Tamil Nadu, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said at NDTV Profit Conclave 2026.

title: 'Vijay Will Have Impact, Will See If He Takes Away Women Vote': N Sitharaman On Tamil Nadu Polls
content: Actor-turned-poltician Vijay, whose party is making its poll debut, will have an impact on the Tamil Nadu election, declared Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Exclusive: LCA Tejas Won't Become Dated. Defence Secretary Explains Why
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has placed a large order for 180 Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Tejas. However, some have speculated that by the time the IAF gets all the aircraft it had ordered, these platforms would become dated.

title: LED Bulb Found In 1-Year-Old Gujarat Boy's Windpipe After Weeks Of Illness
content: After weeks of failed treatments, it was discovered that what had been misdiagnosed as a common respiratory infection was actually a small LED bulb lodged deep within his windpipe.

title: "We Never Escalate, But...": PM's Economic Adviser To NDTV On Trade Deal
content: Sanjeev Sanyal, a member of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister, has called the latest developments in India-US bilateral activities on trade a "strong deal in the pipeline".

title: On Camera, Group Of Men Beat Each Other At Popular Noida Mall, 2 Injured
content: Members of a group allegedly fought among themselves at a Noida bar after a minor argument escalated.

title: "Future Hiring Will Be Impacted": Chief Economic Adviser On AI Role
content: Acknowledging it is difficult to give precise answers, Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran warned on Saturday that AI advancements put coding and cognitive jobs at risk, which will inevitably affect hiring trends.
